bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, June 18, 1880

div1.p: Reed is glad McPherson arrived safely back at the post. He comments on their new roommate. Reed's wife is sick.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, June 18, 1880
div1.p:
You letter dated
San Jose April 29th after roam-
ing about the Country, “seeking
whom it might devour,” for lo!
these many days, has, at last, reached
the embrace of your poor old
“Daddie”, & right glad am I to hear
from my dear boy, once more-
To be sure, you have had a
sweet old time since January
3rd! Why, I should doff my “som-
-brero” & remove my shoes in
the presence of such a tried
old Veteran! Bless you
my boy, I am glad, heartily glad,
that you came through it all
without a broken bone, or the
loss of the a lock of your hair.
Of course, you were surprised
to find me gone from Apache
on your return- It was, in-
deed, a perfect surprise to me-
fairly knocked me down the
stairs. I really wanted to re-
-main very much & grasp your
paw once more, and talk over
matters in general. But as I
had a chance to come & as the
attractions, at this end of the
line, were so very great, I did
not lose a moment in coming-
I had intended to pack away
all your chattels carefully, but
as Dr McCreery assured me that
your “traps” should be left un-
-touched just as they were, I thought
it best not to disturb them. I
trust you found every thing in
proper place & as you left
them. I don't know, my dear
Dorsey, how well you will like
Dr Mc, or how agreeably you will
get along with him; but I don't
think that you and the doctor will
“gee” very well. I don't think
he is the most sociable fellow
I ever met- His conceit, perhaps,
is an obstacle to his sociability.
But you may find him differently.
I am now on a month's leave & shall
ask for an extension of another
month, taking me up to August 8th
I shall then ask to be assigned to
duty- Don't know where I shall go-
I see by the last paper (Army Jourl)
that Gatewood has been relieved from
Command of Indian Co. & Tommy assigned
to it. Give them both my best love-
When you next write to your girl,
be kind enough to remember me
to her “on general principles,” you
know- Excuse this very short note,
but I have a sick wife to attend-
Please write very soon, & tell me
all about your plans- Give my
regards to all who inquire me, and believe me,
as always,
